question:
Healthcare should not be provided for free regardless of a person's income. The
health of an individual is in their own hands. To what extent do you agree or
disagree?
text: Free healthcare system has now become an important topic of discussion
worldwide. While some people think that such a facility should not be provided
free of cost and people should solely be responsible for their own health
issues, I opine that if not completely free, government should set reasonable
charges for each kind of medical service and at the same time, citizens should
also act responsibly towards maintaining their own well-being.
On the one hand, those who favour paid healthcare services irrespective of one's
earnings, believe that such a facility poses threat to the national funds
collected from the tax payers that could be otherwise invested in other priority
areas such as education and science researches. With the paid services, people
might also start paying more attention towards their own health in the fear of
spending hefty amounts on medications. Additionally, sometimes individuals fall
prey to life-threating diseases because of their own unhealthy liftstyle. To
exemplify, a smoking addict, if gets diagnosed with lung cancer, should be the
only one paying for his own actions instead of taking advantages of the free
medical services.
On the other hand, not everybody can afford whopping hospital charges for the
unprecidented medical afflications they might suffer from due to various genetic
and environmental factors. Therefore, in my view, medical facilities should be
provided at reasonable prices which a common man can avail himself. To
illustrate, Canada has a provision of free health care services for its
citizens, and people pay a minimal monthly fee which helps the authorities to
maintain the system. Furthermore, it is the duty of every individual to look
after themselves and not just rely on the government faciities for their own
benefits.
To conclude, despite the advantages of making healthcare a paid service such as
wiser investment of national funds and more awareness among people for being
health conscious, I perceive that medical facilities should be availed at a
minimal cost in order to help both government and people in supporting and using
these services respectively.
